Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; rosette and part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; below, faded white above red band; exterior: chequer band at lip above broken maeander frize between lines; below, painted decoration consisting of sphinx (head with red on hair remaining) to right; further right, tail of second sphinx to right; pendant triangle, elaborate rosette, trace of square and group of short vertical strokes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd belongs in the Wild Goat Style; however, the presence of elaborate interior decoration places it later in the Chian pottery sequence, most appropriately in the Mature Animal Style. Lemos erroneously identifies the depiction as the head of a goose. For parallels regarding the sphinx, see British Museum 1924,1201.255 and 1924,1201.264. See also Louvre AM1362 (1) which may be by the same painter.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 240, no.208)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0539) (phase 2)
